intro: Anisosepalum lewallei, commonly known as the Lewalle's anisosepalum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a distinctive sepal arrangement that sets it apart from other orchid species. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
